column4: W: GPG error: http://archive.ubuntu.com breezy-backports Release: The following signatures were invalid: BADSIG 40976EAF437D05B5 Ubuntu Archive Automatic Signing Key <ftpmaster@ubuntu.com>
what have I broken? :/
nothing you might have to add the key
I still get the error after importing it
can you pastebin the output of sudo apt-get update please
http://name.pastebin.com/649154
you did both commands for the key import including where it says "key" you added the key number?
let me see output of that whne your done too
http://name.pastebin.com/649157
you can still grab updates and stuff right?
i have a feeling its something on thier side. i would say email the guy and see what he says there may be a new key for it and hasnt been updated yet
do you have the backports repo? and I dont think the updates work
i dont use backports
i may still have my breezy list hold on a sec
getting key now
here is the key listed 437D05B5
email the guy at teh email address and explain what is going on
for you to get stuff froma repo you dont need a key
only thing a key does is verify  some 3rd party repos dont have a key (atleast not released)
make sure the repo itself is correct no stray marks stuff like that
paste your /etc/apt/sources.list to pastebin please
also ompaul has a good point since ubuntu doesnt support the backports iirc its a team of users
it all looks right messy but right email the guy and let him know its not something on your end
